product_overview: SmartNShine is an AI-powered Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Resume Builder. It leverages modern web technologies combined with AI features, allowing users to create, edit, optimize, analyze, and manage resumes tailored for ATS compatibility and job matching success.
core_goals: Enable users to seamlessly upload, parse, and structure resumes using AI-powered parsing.
Provide an intuitive rich-text resume editor with real-time preview and AI enhancement features.
Allow users to select and customize ATS-friendly resume templates with easy switching.
Analyze resumes against job descriptions for ATS optimization and provide actionable feedback.
Offer machine learning powered job matching and skill gap analysis to improve job application efficacy.
Facilitate GitHub profile integration to import projects and enrich resumes.
Provide a comprehensive dashboard for users to manage resumes and quick access to resume-related actions.
Offer robust user authentication with traditional and OAuth methods ensuring secure access.
Deliver administrative tools for user, AI usage, feedback, and template management with analytics.
Ensure a responsive, accessible, secure, and performant web application experience.
key_features: Full user authentication system supporting JWT, OAuth (Google and GitHub), password reset, and session management.
Resume upload supporting PDF/DOCX formats with file size validation and AI-based text extraction and parsing using Google Gemini AI.
Rich text editor built with TipTap allowing section-based editing, drag-and-drop reordering, live preview, and AI enhancements for summaries, experiences, skills, and achievements.
A variety of ATS-optimized resume templates with customizable color themes and instant preview capabilities.
An ATS Analyzer providing AI-driven scoring, keyword matching, and detailed improvement suggestions to optimize resumes.
Machine learning-powered job searching and smart job matching with compatibility scoring and skill gap insights.
GitHub OAuth integration enabling profile, project, and contribution imports directly into the resume projects section.
User dashboard listing all saved resumes, supporting resume version management, deletion, and creation.
Admin dashboard with detailed analytics, user management, AI quota controls, feedback and contact message handling, template management, and system logs.
Global dark mode toggle with persistence and navigation blocking to prevent data loss on unsaved edits.
user_flow_summary: New users start by registering or logging in via email/password or OAuth providers (Google, GitHub).
Users upload resumes via drag-and-drop or file browser; AI parses the file and redirects to the editor with structured data.
In the editor, users edit various resume sections with AI assistance, change templates, reorder content, save changes, and export PDFs.
Users analyze their resumes against job descriptions via the ATS Analyzer, receiving scores and optimization suggestions; they can then refine resumes accordingly.
Users perform ML-based job matching by submitting job descriptions, viewing match scores, skill gaps, and recommendations.
Users import GitHub projects via OAuth for automatic project addition in resumes.
Admin users manage users, monitor AI analytics and quotas, handle contact and feedback messages, maintain templates, and adjust application settings through the admin panel.
validation_criteria: Users must be able to register, login, and securely authenticate via both email/password and OAuth.
Resume uploads should accept only valid PDF/DOCX files under 5MB and reject invalid or oversized files with clear errors.
Rich text editor must reflect AI enhancements instantly and support drag-and-drop reorder without data loss.
Resume saves should persist and be retrievable in the dashboard; deleted resumes are removed accurately.
ATS Analyzer must accurately compute scores, keyword matches, and feedback consistent with provided job descriptions.
ML job matching results should reflect correct compatibility scores and skill gap analyses.
GitHub imports correctly populate project sections without duplication or data loss.
Admin functionalities should respect role permissions, data should be accurate, and changes must persist.
UI must be responsive across devices and support dark mode with theme persistence.
Security best practices including rate limiting, data sanitization, JWT expiration, and role-based access control are enforced throughout.
